issues.description: Return type mismatch for Farm.addAnimal(Animal): the UML in the problem statement specifies addAnimal(...) : boolean (i.e., it should return a boolean), but the solution and template use/expect a void method (the solution implements public void addAnimal(Animal)). This inconsistency can confuse students about the correct method signature to implement and may cause tests or student implementations to fail if they follow the UML instead of the provided solution/template.
issues.suggested_fix:
Make the return type consistent across artifacts. Preferred fixes:
- Update the UML in problem_statement.md to show addAnimal(animal: Animal):void to match the textual description and the solution/template; OR
- Change the template and solution signatures to public boolean addAnimal(Animal animal) and return animals.add(animal); (and update any tests/explanations accordingly). Ensure the template method stub and the exercise text/UML are synchronized so students are not confused about which signature to implement.
